CatDescriptText: Fred Harper, restaurant worker, Bedford Ave. and Ann Simon, housewife, Oakland, were part of the Pittsburgher's Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1960 with question: "Do you think that economic status, race, or religion influences court decisions in civil and criminal cases?" Fred Harper's answer reads: "Yes, I feel that juries do not give as much consideration to cases involving persons of the lower economic classes."  Ann Simon's answer reads: "These factors play an important part.  For majority group members, this is good."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Fred Harper wearing light colored polo shirt and hat, standing on Liberty Avenue across from Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of Ann Simon wearing plaid skirt and blouse with flower, standing on Liberty Avenue across from Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
